word: LEVI F. STOCKMAN WAS A YOUTHFUL METHODIST MINISTER OF THE STATE OF MAINE WHO IN 1842, WITH ABOUT THIRTY OTHER METHODIST MINISTERS, EMBRACED AND BEGAN TO PREACH THE SECOND ADVENT OF CHRIST. HE WAS LABORING IN PORTLAND, MAINE, WHEN IN 1843 HIS HEALTH FAILED. HE DIED OF TUBERCULOSIS ON JUNE 25, 1844. IT WAS TO HIM THAT MRS. WHITE, AS A GIRL, WENT FOR ADVICE WHEN IN HER DISCOURAGEMENT GOD SPOKE TO HER IN TWO DREAMS. (SEE EARLY WRITINGS, PP. 12, 78-81; PROPHETIC FAITH OF OUR FATHERS, VOL. 4, PP. 780-782.)
